intro: Trigonochilum mentigerum, commonly known as the yellow twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. The plant has a unique morphology, featuring a short, thick rhizome and a single, lance-shaped leaf. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with a distinctive three-lobed lip. Trigonochilum mentigerum is known for its specialized pollination mechanisms, often relying on specific insect species for reproduction.
